8963357C5B544EC4906FE4448064B21C.description: evaluate group processes, and personal contributions to group processes, to determine and communicate strengths and areas for improvement

3853E0CB10A04FDCAF370D320802AB3A.description: identify leadership roles within a group to enhance personal leadership skills

3EB58523ED34460188B251021C51B19F.description: identify and demonstrate the responsibilities of each member within a group; e.g., leader, recorder, motivator

F63D911087794B38A2B83CE9C7397C16.description: acknowledge conflicting points of view within a group and contribute to compromise in a positive manner, using a variety of strategies; e.g., follow a problem-solving or issue-resolution model

1F5F128E410E44C49C52B4487B888452.description: identify and model motivational techniques, e.g., positive reinforcement, suggestions and paraphrasing, to focus group members on tasks and achieve group goals

B9C97D3842804F9A804D9544B364C5CF.description: identify and demonstrate appropriate behaviour within a group; e.g., listen without interrupting, contribute when appropriate, disagree and/or offer suggestions in an appropriate manner

044E60084AFB456880ED16EE90F5B9FF.description: communicate appropriately with group members to develop and/or identify goals, generate ideas, monitor progress and share responsibility for the completion of a project/group goal

96F2CFCD55B142CE8E56295A37067700.description: distinguish among constructive criticism, ridicule and sarcasm and identify strategies to respond appropriately

CE641B721B0A48489BCBACEAF4CD0181.description: identify and model the behaviours of a successful student and/or worker; e.g., listen to and follow directions, seek assistance, arrive on time, organize materials, paraphrase directions, prioritize tasks and recognize expectations

6B15C9F2E0BF4ABEBC7A3830B13B354B.description: contribute collaboratively in group situations by asking questions and listening and building on the ideas of others

F2FEFD94CA43452DBE90395A8C2735F9.description: demonstrate respect for their rights and the rights of others, within a group and a community, by being fair and honest, demonstrating integrity and personal ethics and by valuing equity within the group

E15579EBFBDF4E118EA396C6DA21989A.description: use inclusive language and behaviour and create texts in ways that demonstrate respect for people of different heritage, cultures, genders, ages, abilities, opinions and communities

0F1636AA3EBC47BD95287B55397E73FC.description: participate in organizing and celebrating special events, considering the various ways language arts are used across cultures, age groups and genders to honour and celebrate people and accomplishments; e.g., Aboriginal and other cultural/community events

0B9A6EF16C2B42F7AA7EC672CE9B78A9.description: analyze how texts reflect the traditions, beliefs and technologies of different cultures, communities or periods in history; e.g., Aboriginal peoples

DEAE7B527906474EAB95E570FF6A568E.description: clarify and enhance their understanding, perspectives and opinions by examining the ideas of others

8559ABC871D04E2A832D751425A3EBA9.description: recognize that individual differences and perspectives are influenced by culture, religion, age, gender and experiences and are valuable and honourable

A8893CA29A644AC4ACB9308611298175.description: examine how ideas, people, experiences and cultural traditions and values are portrayed in print and nonprint texts and compare their own with others' understanding; e.g., Aboriginal oral stories and artifacts

4E0CDF39E14249D598F3EAB39806FB3E.description: Respect themselves and others and strengthen community

4EFE0A19E66D43168F09EF809A1A6EB9.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to respect, support and collaborate with others.

B47979E80267411399AE2CE997F79F2D.description: use appropriate listening and viewing skills to demonstrate respect and consideration; e.g., make eye contact, nod and face the presenter/presentation

4AE37E8ADE9241B4A49D7A5F4076FE75.description: listen and view attentively and actively to carry out instructions; e.g., identify important ideas, organize and classify information

0D1FA16C30204905BEC99BBE48F3B672.description: integrate a variety of media and display techniques, as appropriate, to enhance the appeal and accuracy of presentations

5CCE086A41F94FFA97FE6B0511229AF0.description: plan and shape presentations to achieve particular purposes or effects and use feedback to make modifications

0EE541D3720144A0B74DD13FC469F416.description: Use effective oral and visual communication

D0BAE078B7D94EE99F6F78268B494646.description: clarify and support ideas or opinions with details, visuals or media techniques

7BC6AA47FF384D14B86A68283627B4E9.description: select and organize graphics effectively to communicate and support information and ideas

A068C748A57B43F689EDB481E0D60FBF.description: recognize the need for preparedness in effective communication

075230844E244B0DAAFE891F7A2E2E6B.description: apply appropriate verbal and nonverbal strategies when presenting; e.g., tone, volume, eye contact, gestures and posture

4F9F90C83E97472A98B2FEBE6050E97F.description: recognize that different settings may require different techniques or different forms of verbal and nonverbal communication; e.g., volume at different settings and the size of visuals

FCF6625120B5422A94E0E3237E2D6D29.description: plan and create short, small-group, whole-class and other presentations to share information and ideas

E6DA2A22A44F45A0AA12273D9236DDFF.description: present information using various forms of print and nonprint texts; e.g., posters, documents, charts, graphs, timetables, calendars, paintings, drawings, collages, cartoons, multimedia presentations and Web pages

44369AE3CD094BF0A81A546556D6A39C.description: apply appropriate common conventions when integrating information gathered from various sources; e.g., word processing, publishing, multimedia software, spreadsheets, graphics and database templates

1155114808F14F3683AFD01F94A1667B.description: identify everyday situations in which careful attention to correct capitalization and punctuation is particularly important; e.g., cover letters for employment and writing at the workplace

7E7EBB194A274730A62DDA4DDE48A856.description: use appropriate capitalization and punctuation when referencing oral, print and other texts

D729D314A16349C38BE7566AD745642F.description: attend to capitalization and punctuation conventions; e.g., use periods and commas appropriately with quotation marks, use commas to separate phrases and clauses in their own writing

35A9E128D8244B5DBCBCBA8CE1091162.description: identify everyday situations in which careful attention to correct spelling is particularly important; e.g., complete forms and schoolwork

AEF32D04315143A3AB0B95F6C07422CB.description: use a variety of strategies to verify or correct spelling; e.g., dictionary, thesaurus and electronic software

4CAD4D1F2B084A22905FCC574D434261.description: develop a systematic and effective approach to studying and remembering the correct spelling of key words

B88F202D31B9430ABCF5523C674E0CAC.description: attend to spelling conventions; e.g., confirm spelling, remember key words, develop and use their knowledge of spelling generalization and how words are formed

171037549C0B4A199C87E8625D668E8F.description: distinguish between formal and informal language conventions and recognize the appropriate use of each; e.g., oral language use during a job interview and when speaking with friends

BAD138DE3BF6443AADFC2EAC3F266BDF.description: attend to grammar conventions; e.g., subject-verb agreement in sentences; use of a variety of simple, compound and complex sentences; use of transitional devices and pronouns; use of consistent verb tenses

63FBAFC708084DD8BC56CA400F263BB0.description: use appropriate tools, e.g., handbooks, exemplars, models, dictionaries, spell and grammar check software, to assist in attending to conventions

53647841A90F443DBC4CF205C71C59EB.description: use metacognition strategies to examine the effectiveness and limitations of various forms of texts for an intended purpose and audience

31DDC678FD504163809EA64252437F81.description: use a consistent style within a print or multimedia product; e.g., layout, headers, footers, margins and columns

3DA1E606BFF74038800F3F809A691695.description: explore and select appropriate aspects of style, e.g., font size and style, colours, spacing of text, image placement, sound and video links, within the presentation form or product, to convey meaning to the audience

EF16BD2C5D23458E9BDF9E32483345F6.description: experiment with figurative language, illustrations, voice, sentence patterns, video effects, music and other techniques to provide emphasis, express emotion or create a mood

D620E82C2306466C98D1130082537FB3.description: identify and infer the literal and figurative meanings of words and/or phrases in context using metaphors, similes, idioms and analogies

EDD2506F1A5F443FA9371AF06CA2AC93.description: recognize that new words, phrases and manners of expression enter the language through popular culture, technology and other languages

AFA773E271574094A1A708E460003280.description: identify the differences between standard English, slang, colloquialisms and jargon, and the denotative and connotative meanings of words, and examine how these differences affect meaning; e.g., accent or dialect in local communities/regions

A8C9BDBB712548F8A16E45F2CCE29587.description: use an appropriate handwriting style, word processor, font type and size, graphics and other techniques to produce their own texts, considering the content, audience and purpose

5ABEA27631714D85BCCA000FFFB0F040.description: demonstrate the effective effort and behaviour required to achieve a goal or create a product; e.g., be positive, focus on the goal, work independently and/or in groups as appropriate, take initiative

D8B43E1994144469B0B511952B6BD0E3.description: revise to enhance sentence structure and variety, word choice and appropriate tone and to eliminate unnecessary repetition

FE30583A1D704117852205953C364E03.description: revise the introduction, conclusion and supporting ideas and information to enhance coherence and clarify meaning

80B8632502C34B37BC16D2EDE44067DD.description: revise to ensure consistency of content in the use of a main idea, a point of view and supporting details

9B66E74973094EC3A6CB32C7BB3B515F.description: select and use appropriate tools to edit and revise; e.g., dictionary, thesaurus and electronic editing functions

3B694289D19E424FBE457466F3577219.description: proofread, edit and revise to follow language conventions; e.g., capitalization, punctuation, sentence structure, parts of speech, dialogue, grammar, spelling and word usage

54BBF4796E0246F0A50D66BFF1EFA30D.description: work collaboratively to make appropriate revisions based on feedback

51592A25CF6945A89AC83C9485AD0F71.description: apply appropriate metacognition strategies to appraise their own and others' work

A93574B1D6FF40C79171610F3D6EADA5.description: identify and assess content and presentation features that enhance or detract from the product and suggest/make changes

5B4E5C868D8C46B8841C541501B43F1C.description: examine the content and effectiveness of the product/presentation, considering the intended audience, purpose and form

D646807A80904AE5BCF788A7F3FCB3F5.description: determine if directions have been followed and if the product is on topic and demonstrates unity and coherence

08A2F1BFAC0D47B585FFD45B9DDDB312.description: share oral, print and other media texts, in draft form, in a way that will elicit useful feedback

312B7027D2114F9ABE7F46DD7AC1F7D3.description: Appraise their own and others' work

841BED54D9F94E45891AC1B70FD4BDF6.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to enhance the clarity and artistry of communication.

1507BFB142424941B89EE28BBE956B7A.description: use appropriate metacognition strategies to assess the effectiveness of the research process and identify strategies to improve future research

E7CF53ED7DB345D4B6FF45310B94749E.description: demonstrate responsibility for following appropriate security and safety measures when using technology and the Internet; e.g., language and etiquette, ergonomics to promote personal health and well-being and respect the products and privacy of others

D992A50A330E40DCA0CEA76CBF4E59EB.description: apply the appropriate moral and ethical standards acceptable for a presentation

9A4B393DE29E43BA9F79000C162D8740.description: use appropriate oral, visual, print and/or other media effectively to inform and engage the audience

869554F6E8384DF1BD458CB2FC6095DB.description: communicate ideas and information in a variety of oral, print and other media texts; e.g., posters, photo essays, brochures, video/multimedia presentations, interviews, newspaper articles and expository/descriptive oral reports

8EDD11E167AD4DA38F508F190C64C64B.description: recognize that different viewpoints on issues may exist and that information may have a bias or be limited

C2C9D0550193489F834F8B18C71F11DF.description: use appropriate criteria and metacognition strategies to assess whether the information gathered is relevant, important, accurate, complete, current and significant to determine its usefulness to the overall purpose, audience and form of presentation

98D0265A7923497C8E313343E1F85C95.description: reference information sources using appropriate form and consistency

2D5CEC49994E415FAC6A9FD211B7C92F.description: use appropriate keyboarding techniques, e.g., proper fingering when using alphabet and punctuation keys, and apply appropriate strategies to increase accuracy and speed

0DD60E0A345C48BAAE2588B315F59524.description: record information accurately and completely, in a consistent and appropriate style, using quotations and citing sources within footnotes and using word processing software when appropriate

7E101B9BA19442A48C1326E6D23C7A8E.description: make notes in point form, summarizing main ideas and supporting details, using appropriate strategies; e.g., headings, subheadings, key words, supporting details and phrases and graphic organizers

978B129036844A02BC60D4BDE5EE2910.description: integrate ideas and information using their prior knowledge and new information and ideas

6343D0545C054D76B9DC65D289889BEB.description: organize ideas and information, logically and creatively, using categories, questions, sequence and technology, as appropriate

BF09F4D7593D4F5E98205EB6584E6DBA.description: select alternate information sources as appropriate

DAB5BE5CBC8D40B7AA72D7D5D0468985.description: use pre-established criteria to assess whether sources of information are credible, factual, current and appropriate to the purpose, audience and form of presentation

4AA6686E38A24594BEEBC7D2E2F3EA9C.description: select appropriate technologies for gathering, generating and recording information and other materials to create a product

C032715AED9D483293332EC4BF85D1F4.description: record key ideas and information using appropriate strategies; e.g., take notes and use technology

6ECC0C2CB4E8431BAD69A2A4958BFDF1.description: distinguish between fact and opinion in informationv

172B40C1B51C48049C035F976E2B8838.description: scan and/or skim to locate specific information quickly, using textual cues and other strategies

E5E5ED981E73441E9615163F88A07177.description: access information using a variety of tools and text features; e.g., headings, bolding, summaries, key words, electronic searches, visual and sound effects, page layouts, font styles and sizes

E5320339BBAA47A9A6D052E5A9133A65.description: use a variety of oral, print, visual and multimedia information sources appropriate to the inquiry; e.g., textbooks, encyclopedias, graphs, oral stories, artifacts, diagrams, posters, pictures, films, community members, databases, CD-ROMs and the Internet

E138432B71634C93BB0C9002305792FA.description: assess and modify their plan as needed

2FFBFA68B4904A07B34505C14A7631F2.description: create a plan to access, gather, record, organize and present information, considering the topic, time, purpose, audience, form, access to technology and other resources and using appropriate strategies; e.g., webs, outlines and discussions

E4229E658F0E404A8CF31078B88077E5.description: select appropriate information sources for a topic, audience, purpose and form; e.g., library, encyclopedia, community members and Web sites

68C19B29AD9F40DDB7463F54FD01AE4C.description: identify and record their prior knowledge related to a topic and determine information gaps

51C936BD9C5E40CA99B7CE988803BAA7.description: use note taking, outlining or representing strategies to summarize important ideas and information in oral, print and other media texts

5B85F737CE8449779E2BFCA41DF2C79C.description: identify a tentative presentation form appropriate to the audience, purpose and point of view

20277C9C67B74D1ABA608FF8C9F19B20.description: create categories and questions using who, what, where, when, why and how to guide inquiry and topic development

D37D5D79C00A409EAFF07F4DF685BE42.description: consider a variety of factors that may influence a topic; e.g., audience, purpose, point of view and form

2E961EFF8D9046C9A1BE25E8C85C95A7.description: use metacognition and a variety of other strategies, e.g., discussions, brainstorms and webs, to identify a topic and focus ideas

7878BE890A0943AFAE673105EAD6564F.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to manage ideas and information.

997861F48B2548738C0CD6D01C7C799C.description: complete actual, or samples of, common home- and work-related forms; e.g., Social Insurance Number (SIN) form, job application form and performance checklists

62262D1F34CB4C81BE9F04A19CDF8C56.description: create a variety of texts to examine the connections between form, elements and techniques; e.g., advertisements, brochures, book jackets, plays, poetry, instruction sheets, posters and multimedia presentations

0145A7A41CE94251AB8519630DAE332F.description: create a variety of oral, print and other media texts with well-developed, supported and linked ideas and components, including: forms of functional writing, e.g., rsum, cover letter, memo, using electronic and other templates as appropriate and descriptive, persuasive, expository and narrative paragraphs and three- to five-paragraph essays

596213EF3C9B492FB70137C445B5406C.description: use a variety of techniques to communicate meaning and enhance the effectiveness of texts; e.g., colour, shape, composition, suspense, foreshadowing, flashbacks, word choice, gestures, movement, balance, camera angles, framing, irony and symbolism

021CD65451EC4686B9E84041FFFC16D5.description: Elaborate on the expression of ideas

B4C144E9234C40CA808ACDEDD207EC64.description: create oral, print and other media texts related to issues encountered in their own life

AC51A15472124FC49FC5226410F132CC.description: apply appropriate prewriting strategies to explore, develop and justify their own ideas, opinions and point of view and develop new ideas and determine the scope of writing

7C29DE33E1E04431B2DE118733F9F312.description: take ownership of text creation by selecting a topic, concept or idea that is personally meaningful, engaging and based on personal experience and/or prior knowledge

55559046724044659D7DAF9C2027C121.description: analyze the creative uses of language and visuals in popular culture and explain the ways in which imagery and figurative language, e.g., simile, hyperbole and metaphor, convey meaning, tone and mood

518ED665EB9641718F9F5060C149826B.description: summarize the content of media texts and examine the choices made in planning and producing them

2AC132DBE4BF4563AFFB66E342305D14.description: examine how sound and image work together to create effects in media texts

726EF65BF00744A3917D368AC1A5B811.description: identify graphic design techniques, e.g., graphic quality, colour, sound, camera angle, composition, movement and editing, that create and/or manipulate emotion, mood and point of view

826618FA861B49A9A568BBCC48896A7A.description: examine how narrative hooks, foreshadowing, flashbacks, suspense and surprise endings contribute to the effectiveness of plot development

CA8391B96D8B444A9721D43D349E10AD.description: examine the effectiveness of different types of forms for presenting ideas and information; e.g., presentations of news through television, radio and newspapers; CDs and music videos

967CDF8F2DA44FC28D5F60AE001AA5D3.description: identify various forms and genres of oral, print and other media texts and identify the key characteristics of each

B25F01766380456CBD2ACCAF76656E52.description: examine how the choice of form and genre in oral, visual and multimedia texts is appropriate to the purpose and audience

5B455AE14C284C33BD21ABEFCCBC5C91.description: recognize and appreciate the use and effectiveness of a variety of techniques, e.g., word choice, camera angle, irony, symbolism, line and framing, in communicating meaning and enhancing the text experience for the audience

E30EFADEC79E49A1B31A9644D1D47F82.description: examine the ways that a character can be developed and how character, plot and setting are interconnected, mutually supportive and work together to create mood and tone

B48F280F7A5348528778D5FF9850F1D9.description: use a variety of strategies to understand and follow oral directions; e.g., paraphrase, mental maps, take notes

CBC62410770549BE946E57E1E56F0B7E.description: differentiate between fact and fiction in media portrayals of everyday life

5541946EBBBB4517AC412823EA26F8A6.description: define their own interpretation of texts, based on experience, prior knowledge and evidence from the text

82DEFF2C3E774BF083917E4618BB89FE.description: identify conflict and examine how it develops and may be resolved

E583E3CCA8CE469FABDDF8940B972DB4.description: identify the main message, theme, point of view, argument and lesson or moral within a text

DE838A07A1374F78B0F7315A04191193.description: analyze how the choices, behaviours and motives of characters in texts provide insight into themselves and others

48D7E86C5F144CA896D1B36AAF71105F.description: examine how a character changes as a result of an event within a plot by examining elements of character; e.g., consistency of behaviour and plausibility of change

B49C301D509643118E13E9D3D382A600.description: use metacognition and other appropriate strategies, e.g., graphic organizers and technology, to categorize parts of a plot, e.g., introduction, characters, setting, initial incident, rising action, climax, falling action, resolution and main conflict, and recognize their relationships in developing a story

0DD9A414213E424487728D9D54FCB519.description: justify their point of view and interpretation using evidence from a text

8BB4AE9E94AD464B8DFAE14147C6158A.description: consider the historical context when developing points of view or interpretations of texts

38A27872ABA041F4BA1F916B06DC1712.description: recognize that many interpretations of the same text exist and examine other points of view

0B913F5941DA41A3A04386717084EAB2.description: explore and experience a range of print and nonprint texts from a variety of cultural traditions and genres; e.g., journals, magazine articles, nature programs, diaries, drama, poetry, mysteries, historical fiction, drawings, prints, photographs, advertisements, Aboriginal oral stories, artifacts, films, essays, electronic and print magazines and realistic fiction

2785D5FF835A4DEEB8B9939449E7E5DC.description: skim and scan reference materials to confirm spelling, locate meaning, extend vocabulary, verify usage and address uncertainties; e.g., dictionary, thesaurus, writer's handbook, personal glossary and computer software

343E05D5C7764D618B343710F26D57B4.description: select and apply effective strategies to build on their strengths or address areas for improvement; e.g., context clues, dictionary use, spelling/vocabulary computer software and personal glossary

AA5BC553238A483E918302C03FD29018.description: apply their knowledge of phonics, sight vocabulary and context cues to enhance vocabulary development and spelling

12CE32737E944B458C3291E091ACE460.description: identify and use a variety of cues to enhance their understanding of nonprint texts; e.g., colour, setting, shape, movement, lighting, camera angle and size of images

1D56B20D82B24458A8279CAB0A7C0538.description: use visual and textual cues and structural features to enhance their comprehension of a variety of everyday print and nonprint texts and to read and view with purpose; e.g., newspapers, magazines, instruction manuals, advertisements, schedules and Web sites

C1227E15C5BE4B0CA9321365FCEC4328.description: use a variety of textual cues to enhance understanding; e.g., indexes, tables of contents, chapters, bolded words/phrases, charts, glossaries, graphics and bullets

D1FDD73DC79049B09644FF126A4FA447.description: identify a speaker's nonverbal communication strategies to increase understanding; e.g., posture, eye contact, facial expression and gestures

782E7DB4158246379D93E07BDEEEF537.description: identify and examine the appropriate communication strategies used to convey intent such as verbal/ nonverbal mood indicators; e.g., use of lighting, camera angle, irony, sarcasm, gestures, volume and tone

209CD9E53AB0414E93802E97DE58978A.description: use metacognition and a variety of other strategies to identify and remember main ideas and relevant information in print and nonprint texts; e.g., concept map, mental rehearsal, paraphrase, question and take notes

FD5CFD67EF1B42D286E3F5E1E19799A7.description: paraphrase directions or key messages from various sources, e.g., oral directions, assignments, manuals, diagrams, forms, lists, labels and workbooks, to enhance and verify their understanding of tasks

35480F9C1B094259AEB44855C37EB4F2.description: identify and define new vocabulary specific to a topic to enhance understanding

380C745B1EB44D26899EB46A59091B2C.description: apply a variety of vocabulary strategies, e.g., word attack skills, context clues and dictionary skills, to enhance their comprehension of oral, print and multimedia texts

E96B1E6D3E964635AC33364272CCD7A1.description: apply appropriate reading strategies to enhance understanding; e.g., skim, read out loud, form questions, make predictions, reread and read slowly)

4D853011FB494AE6868EF0B4CA52606C.description: recognize that an interpretation of the same text may vary based on prior knowledge and individual experience

D02F9EF3D6DE44DFA45A19522798E604.description: use their knowledge of text creators, forms and genres, developed during previous experiences, to direct and extend experiences with print and nonprint texts

036F47CE1F5A471BAB0257A7AD053D97.description: connect new ideas and information to prior knowledge to enhance their understanding of print and nonprint texts

763A09D20F334000A9D946096CB2CE9A.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to comprehend and respond personally and critically to oral, print and other media texts.

F29F58B875B8442597C7B6FD13157E3A.description: revise their initial understandings, points of view and responses, based on new ideas, information and feedback

8D94B6661DE9468285DF1164194B1F4C.description: use a variety of strategies to examine, clarify and assess understanding; e.g., discuss, review, reread and reflect

45EF886C31D9432493246E07D931D27B.description: apply metacognition and other strategies to share, examine and re-examine points of view, opinions, experiences, perspectives and interpretations through discussion or by using various communication technologies; e.g., telephone, e-mail

CD69AFD30F434840B3915E8B2AAB584F.description: identify the purpose, message and intended audience of a communication and verify understanding

A0F7DDB5568245468F0A2E6ECC7BEEAE.description: synthesize information from a variety of sources to extend understanding and perspective

831457B62E194079B1F000973CF3648B.description: examine and re-examine ideas, information and experiences from different points of view to find patterns and relationships

6EBF381028F4443694635D37886BFAD7.description: exchange ideas and opinions to clarify understanding and to broaden their personal perspectives

A7759F10C3CA43B58E31B74F8C61DB26.description: assess and revise their personal opinions and ideas, based on alternative opinions and ideas

CDF2D6EBFE4243B7AA6F7D85DCE64CA3.description: acknowledge the value of, and respond constructively to, the ideas and opinions of others when exploring and extending their personal interpretation and perspectives

980E8B30520742EA9F55E24CC91BA303.description: review and revise their language learning plan design to extend language growth

78E506E99F4040B0ACB93253E39A4527.description: investigate career-related language skills using self-evaluation and other strategies to identify attainable career opportunities; e.g., Alberta Learning Information Service (ALIS) Web site, National Occupation Classification (NOC)

5495F2AB42B847528A7C26E86772A140.description: create a language learning plan to meet attainable secondary, post-secondary and career goals and include a record/collection of achievements and goals; e.g., career portfolio

41E427B7591A4454900F8EFCEA353CA4.description: apply self-evaluation and other strategies and tools, e.g., checklists and inventories, to identify language strengths and weaknesses and develop personal language learning goals

C5B13CE161E3491FAB239EC2D81CAD38.description: identify and explain the reasons for their personal preferences; e.g., genres, artists, storytellers, filmmakers and authors

5ED90E0955874510BE9686B261646914.description: extend experiences by exploring and assessing a variety of print and nonprint texts, based on personal preferences and recommendations from others

5FE67F4A076346049D85846C39ED0A06.description: experiment with language to enhance language development; e.g., use new vocabulary, vary sentence structure and use figurative language

1193092E0F7241D69F90400198BF4BF1.description: examine ways that language and forms influence the development and communication of ideas, information and experiences in print and nonprint texts; e.g., read a novel, view a film adaptation and compare the development and communication of the story

FA2FC11C249F4FDE86D74D2A70BA1D6E.description: experiment with language, form, structure and images to create different effects, considering purpose and audience
